title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 646-7.3 - Signs for which permits will not be granted
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 646-7.3 - Signs for which permits will not be granted

State Regulations
(a) Signs containing flashing, intermittent, rotating, or moving light or lights. (b) Signs in excess of 48 square feet in
area. (c) Moving signs. Signs that
move or contain visible parts which move. (d) Neon signs. Signs illuminated by neon
lamps. (e) Signs containing
luminous material, sequin studded letters, or lettering with fluorescent
paint. (f) "A" type signs. Portable
free-standing or "A" type signs. (g) Advertising devices. Displays that
contain banners, balloons, flags, pennants, pinwheels, searchlights or other
attention getting devices. (h) Signs on rocks, trees, etc. Signs affixed to or painted upon rocks, trees, utility poles or other such structures. (i) Parking of advertising vehicles. Vehicles
parked on the street or in locations on private property which have attached
thereto or suspended therefrom any advertising signs. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
§§
646-7.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
